title: FCC allows a power boost for SpaceX’s direct-to-smartphone service
summary:
SpaceX secured permission March 7 to provide direct-to-smartphone satellite services at higher power levels to improve connectivity beyond the reach of cell towers across the United States.
The post FCC allows a power boost for SpaceX’s direct-to-smartphone service appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Earns Best Place to Work in Government for 13th Consecutive Year
summary: For the 13th straight year, NASA has earned the title of Best Place to Work in the Federal Government – large agency – from the Partnership for Public Service. The ranking reflects employee satisfaction and workplace elements across the agency while executing NASA’s mission to explore the unknown and discover new knowledge for the benefit […]

title: U.S. halts satellite imagery support to Ukraine in major policy shift
summary:
The decision cuts off Ukraine's access to the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency's (NGA) commercial satellite imagery platform.
The post U.S. halts satellite imagery support to Ukraine in major policy shift appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Cosmic Mapmaker: NASA’s SPHEREx Space Telescope Ready to Launch
summary: NASA’s latest space observatory is targeting a March 8 liftoff, and the agency’s PUNCH heliophysics mission is sharing a ride. Here’s what to expect during launch and beyond. In a little over a day, NASA’s SPHEREx space telescope is slated to launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket. […]

title: Intuitive Machines’ IM-2 Moon mission ends with lander on its side
summary: A photo from the lunar lander, named Athena, shows it landed inside a crater roughly 250 m from its intended landing site. The spacecraft touched down on the Moon’s surface at 12:28:50 p.m. EST (1728:50 UTC), according to ham radio non-profit AMSAT-DL.

title: NASA Receives Some Data Before Intuitive Machines Ends Lunar Mission
summary: Shortly after touching down inside a crater on the Moon, carrying NASA technology and science on its IM-2 mission, Intuitive Machines collected some data for the agency before calling an early end of mission at 12:15 a.m. CST Friday. As part of the company’s second Moon delivery for NASA under the agency’s CLPS (Commercial Lunar […]

title: Star Catcher lands Space Florida support for satellite power beaming tests
summary:
Star Catcher Industries, a startup designing spacecraft to beam solar energy to other LEO satellites, has secured funding from Florida’s economic development agency to demonstrate the technology at a former Space Shuttle landing site.
The post Star Catcher lands Space Florida support for satellite power beaming tests appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: IM-2 Mission Ends One Day After Lunar Landing

title: NASA Astronaut Tracy Dyson Speaks to Students
summary: NASA Astronaut Tracy Dyson points to the Expedition 71 patch on her flight suit on Wednesday, March 5, 2025. Dyson and her fellow Expedition 71 crewmates Matthew Dominick, Michael Barratt, and Jeanette Epps answered questions from students at Elsie Whitlow Stokes Community Freedom Public Charter School in Washington.
